docs.title: Welcome to My Daily Notes
docs.text: Hi! I'm Florent, and this is where I share my daily thoughts, learnings, and notes.

docs.title: What You'll Find Here
docs.text:
• Daily Notes: My thoughts, learnings, and observations
  • Technical Notes: Programming tips, solutions, and discoveries
  • Personal Reflections: Life lessons and insights

docs.title: Recent Updates
docs.text: Check out my latest notes in the Daily Notes section.

docs.title: About This Site
docs.text:
This site is built with MkDocs and the beautiful Material theme.

I write everything in simple Markdown files and the site updates automatically when I push to GitHub.

Last updated: October 17, 2025

docs.title: About Me
docs.text: I'm Florent DALIGAND, a software developer passionate about web technologies, open source, learning, and sports.

docs.title: This Site
docs.text:
This is my personal space for:

  • Daily notes and thoughts
  • Technical discoveries
  • Learning reflections
  • Project documentation

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
• GitHub: @fdaligand
  • Website: fdaligand.github.io

Built with ❤️ using MkDocs and Material theme

docs.title: GitHub Actions Setup
docs.text: Successfully set up automated deployment! Now when I push markdown files to the repository, the site updates automatically.

docs.title: Workflow Benefits
docs.text:
• Write notes in any markdown editor
  • Push to GitHub
  • Site updates automatically
  • No manual building or deployment needed

Achievement Unlocked

Fully automated note publishing workflow! 🎉

docs.title: Note-Taking Tips
docs.text:
Some best practices I've discovered:

  1. Use consistent date formats - Makes searching easier
  2. Add tags or categories - Helps with organization
  3. Include code snippets - Great for technical notes
  4. Use admonitions - Highlights important information

docs.title: Code Example
docs.text:
# Simple note organization
def create_daily_note(date):
    filename = f"notes/{date.year}/{date.strftime('%B').lower()}.md"
    return filename

More notes coming soon...

docs.title: Learning MkDocs
docs.text:
Today I discovered MkDocs and I'm amazed by how simple it is to create beautiful documentation sites. Just write Markdown and get a professional-looking website!

Key benefits I found: - No need to learn CSS or HTML - Beautiful Material theme out of the box - Automatic navigation generation - Built-in search functionality - Mobile responsive design

docs.title: Technical Discovery
docs.text:
Found a great way to organize daily notes: 

docs/
├── notes/
│   ├── 2024/
│   │   ├── january.md
│   │   ├── february.md
│   │   └── ...
│   └── 2025/
│       └── ...

Pro Tip

Use admonitions like this to highlight important information!

docs.title: Project Ideas
docs.text:
• Set up automated deployment with GitHub Actions

  • Create a simple note-taking workflow

docs.title: Random Thoughts
docs.text: The best tools are often the simplest ones. MkDocs proves this point perfectly.
